intro: Polycarpon, commonly known as common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Polycarpon is an annual herb that blooms from spring to early summer.
